website_summaries.verdict: The most powerful quality wall heater available. Appropriate for colder climates or larger spaces.
pros: Comes in a couple of different power ratings with a maximum of 2250 watts
Heating blower is powerful enough to handle larger rooms and spaces around the home
cons: Higher output ratings require more power to work correctly

customer_reviews.title: Good product, no problems.
customer_reviews.text: Slightly louder than I hoped, but not bad at all and does the job. Hooked it up to a Nest Thermostat E using and RC840T-120 relay and power combined. Works perfect. No issues with the welding as noted by a couple others, but the screws to hold the faceplate in we're a pain. They weren't pre-threaded, and one side was so tight the head broke off the screw when I resored to an impact driver to try and get it in. I had to go find some replacement screws, but sorted it out. Be sure to screw these in without the faceplate the first time to get them primed! Still over all happy and managed to work around the issue.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: I love that the wattage is variable and I can have ...
customer_reviews.text: I replaced the old ugly baseboards heater in my Condo with a few of these. I love that the wattage is variable and I can have the same heater in every room. I installed them at the beginning of the summer and so they didn't get any use until late September. The heaters have been working well since it has been getting cooler outside. Occasionally, they will rattle a bit when they first kick on, which can be kind of annoying, but it seems once they start cycling on and off to maintain the temperature the rattling goes away. It is mostly only when coming on for the first time in a while that the rattling will occur.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin T.Top Contributor: Snowboarding

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal heater. Much better solution than loud ceiling heating fans
customer_reviews.text: This heater is nearly silent and pumps out heat. I have a small bathroom (8'x10') and this will heat it really well. It can be controlled with a wall thermostat or with a dial thermostat (sold separately -  I chose the dial thermostat and it works great. Even from ~1' away the heater is almost impossible to hear and will automatically trigger on and off to maintain your desired temperature. If you are deciding between this and a combo heating/venting fan, take my advice and get this. It is quieter, more controllable, and more effective.
customer_reviews.author: KFahn

customer_reviews.title: Good heater for small space; good value
customer_reviews.text: Installation of heater was straightforward. Instructions were good. Only complaint is that grill screws are silver not white. Heater works well and is quite. Very nice. I am buying another for our entry. However, the on-unit thermostat installation was not as easy. The picture of the mounting bracket is a tiny, bad drawing. The instructions for installation the bracket are non-existantant. But after a couple of tries I got it assembled properly. As mentioned in many online reviews, the screw heads strip out when trying to screw them into the screw holes. I had to drill out the holes and use other phillips screws. Also, please switch the screws to phillips; square head screws strip too easily. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Eugenie Rivers

customer_reviews.title: Great heaters for your home.
customer_reviews.text: My whole house is heated with these space used heaters. I have one in every room. They are energy efficient, quiet, and attractive. A real value for the money. They last years. I gave only replaced two of them in the last 24 years.
customer_reviews.author: Seaellie

customer_reviews.title: Heats very well and quiet operation
customer_reviews.text: Installation was very easy (be sure to follow your local codes). The squirrel cage blower has rubber vibration dampening and other than hearing it pushing air, the heater is silent - no humming or vibration noted on my unit. I've had some heaters that make cracking or popping sounds as they heat and cool, this heater does not make any sounds other than the sound of moving air I mentioned above. The space I'm heating heats exactly as expected for this 1500 watt version.
customer_reviews.author: Walt

customer_reviews.title: As expected. Consider application carefully.
customer_reviews.text: Installed in a small bathroom as booster heat. Room has radiant electric floor and house is in cold climate. I don’t think these types of heaters are particularly well suited as primary heat source, but it kicks out a good amount of heat in a small space quickly when needed. Very quiet but not silent. Smallish thing that the handy-folks will understand: grill screws go into bizarro press-formed part of aluminum housing. Crazy design that works very badly. I’ve stripped multiple screws trying to drive. Very poor design of that detail. You’ll see. Probably not a reason to not buy if otherwise inclined to purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Manitop

customer_reviews.title: Heats my whole basement
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for my freezing cold basement and they are amazing. They heat the whole 750 sqft in less than 30 minutes. One caution though, if you're buying these with the intention of using them with a thermostat, they are high wattage (my two combined are almost 5,000) and you will need an appropriately rated one. King electric makes one, and it works fine, but adds another almost $100 to the cost. If you're using just one, you have more choice.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Unable to use
customer_reviews.text: I initially purchased this product to use in my Master Bathroom which was remodeled in February/March 2020. Unfortunately, the wattage was no good for our small bathroom. Then I intended to use it in our bedroom which gets very cold in the winter time. When we went to install it, the instructions state that you should NOT use within 3 FT of drapes, or any other products that can catch fire, i.e. insulation, in outer wall, etc. Therefore, I am unable to use the product.
customer_reviews.author: Hilary L.

customer_reviews.title: Good price!
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for one that lasted over ten years, so I received my moneys worth from the last one. I have two other ones that are still going strong. I do recommend blowing these out with compressed air once a year, as dust can cause the thermal protection to shut these down if they are not serviced periodically.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Willey

customer_reviews.title: easy hit
customer_reviews.text: i needed to run heat to a few rooms in an ADU. it was either portable heat, central heat, or something like this. i gave this a shot, and it was definitely the right move. very affordable, disappears on the wall, and works great.
customer_reviews.author: nikg

customer_reviews.title: Maintenance Joy
customer_reviews.text: I’m transitioning a 2007 saltwater boat for a new freshwater life. The pilothouse heater was corroded and need replacement. I was shocked to find King still manufacturing the same heater 13 years later, but when I opened the box and inspected the design, I can understand why. This heater was well designed to begin with and built for rugged use. Imagine my surprise when I figured the entire interior removes with one screw allowing me to easily swap guts (The joy part) to make the repairs. Well done King
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good heater, crumby case.
customer_reviews.text: As many others have pointed out the shell is poorly assembled. Mine only had 2 of the 8 spot weld hold. I ended up using 1/2” self tapping screws to hold it together. The screws for the grate also snapped as many others have experienced. I used 1 1/4 metal to wood fastening screws in their place. So ditch the hardware and check your spot welds. The unit itself works fine and is quieter than the free standing space heater it replaced.
customer_reviews.author: K. Geisler

customer_reviews.title: Nice heat solution.
customer_reviews.text: King Pic-A-Watt heaters are superior to any other in-wall fan forced heaters that I have installed. They are quieter, solidly built and the ability to select the appropriate wattage to a room size makes these a no-brainer. I have been upgrading from inefficient baseboard heaters anytime I can. Installs easily if you have some experience at this sort of thing.
customer_reviews.author: Index David

customer_reviews.title: Good Replacement for Electric Baseboard Radiant Heaters
customer_reviews.text: One of the 2 units has a fan has a little 'tick' in that I'm hoping goes away however so far, the heating is so much better than the radiant heat from the electric baseboard heaters these replaced. I would have like to run them at the full 2250 watts however my electrician recommended against that because of the amp draw. For the pair it would be close to 19amps at 2250 watts (240 volt) as opposed to almost 15amps at 1750 watts (240 volts). What do you guys think?
customer_reviews.author: Mike Romine

customer_reviews.title: Small Compact but Packs a lot of HEAT
customer_reviews.text: As small as the heaters are in size they most definitely make up in heat output. My kitchen, living room, and dining room heat up very quickly and I am frequently having to dial down the temperature setting, but that is a good thing.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Sternfels

customer_reviews.title: Quiet
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and very quiet. Customer service at King Electric is top notch. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: nordakoda

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation and easy to select wattage.
customer_reviews.text: The unit was a replacement for a similar unit that was about 20 years old. I have always been happy with the old one and expect the new one to last as long. Easy to slip into the old spot and easy to select the wattage you need.
customer_reviews.author: Rich B.

customer_reviews.title: Great little heater
customer_reviews.text: Nice compact little heater. I like the pic a watt feature as the tiny bathroom I don't want to install a thermostat and a timer, just a timer so I wired it for 1000w. Only complaint is the fan is secured to the housing by a single screw, should start least have two. I'll make a bracket myself and fix that so it's a little more secure although it seems fine as it is
customer_reviews.author: Guthrie L.

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to gas furnaces
customer_reviews.text: I'm very satisfied with this product. This is not a heater for amateur do it yourselfers. You may be required to upgrade power panel and install heavy gauge electrical cable according to electrical standards. This is a great alternative to gas furnaces, specially when you have a photovoltaic system in your home to produce your own energy. I purchased 2 units in January of 2018, I would have bought another 2 a year later but prices have gone up considerably that a plug in heater seems more reasonable to heat a bedroom.
customer_reviews.author: Camilo M.

customer_reviews.title: It does not come with any controls
customer_reviews.text: This heater has no controls on the heater & can only be run by an separate controller that is not included with the heater. It must be ordered separately which is something not mentioned in the description. This entails another hole in the wall to hook it up. I returned the unit unable to ever turn it on,.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Lou

customer_reviews.title: Best electric heater ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: No comparison between this and the typical 120V plug in type heaters. For a medium sized family room or older / poorly insulated room, this is more than worth the investment of time / effort. Product is well made, and looks almost indistinguisable from a standard forced air wall vent once installed. Besides getting a separate 220 V line installed, installation took maybe 15 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Kingston Special

customer_reviews.title: it works.. but some quality control issues.
customer_reviews.text: The quality control on the wall can is bad, mine had a bad spot weld on the lower left corner which I fixed with a sheet metal screw. Also both included register screws snapped off while screwing them in, I have never seen such cheap screws usually the Philips slot will strip out before it simply crumbles. I have it installed with 4 baseboards on a 30 amp circuit with a 22 amp relay. Total watts for all is 5250. I plan on replacing 1 more 1000 watt baseboard with one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Snorkel

customer_reviews.title: Delivered on schedule. Works well. Quiet, well ...
customer_reviews.text: Delivered on schedule. Works well. Quiet, well designed heater guts. I would give it 5 stars except that the wall can was not properly fabricated. Despite no apparent shipping damage, two of the 8 spot welds on the can had broken loose. I repaired with pop rivets and installed. Then I noticed that the screws that hold the front grille in place are too long and won't screw all the way into the threaded receiving slots of the can. I had to go out and buy 2 shorter screws to get the grille on right. Photos available on request.
customer_reviews.author: Jim V.

customer_reviews.title: Fan is noisy
customer_reviews.text: Puts out a lot of heat, using 2250 W output really runs the electric bill up so I used a lower rating, fan is noisy, Would be nice to slow the fan down,
customer_reviews.author: Randol L. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a 12 x 12 guestroom I built. The 'tap-a-watt' feature is perfect. Tap what works, save electricity. Made in the USA is always a plus for me.
customer_reviews.author: Don K

customer_reviews.title: not completely quiet but plenty warm
customer_reviews.text: Can be heard in a quiet room but only if you really listen for it, sound very quickly fades to background noise and you forget it's there. Heat output is very nice and pushes warm air a good distance away, I'm using it to get a fairly big room to tolerable temp and it does the job beautifully. Would definitely recommend and may even purchase more for my house.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Ekedahl

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: I transferred all my baseboard heaters to this model. I had to replace some of them over the years but a couple of them have been working for over 20 years! Good product.
customer_reviews.author: P. W. C.

customer_reviews.title: Great.
customer_reviews.text: I give five stars for quality but you should know you cannot mount this heater on it's side. You have to mount it as shown. The instructions don't say that but the company does. I had to but the vertical model, not enough room in the wall from window to door.
customer_reviews.author: Feehan

customer_reviews.title: We love this heater!!!
customer_reviews.text: The King paw is a lot of heat in a small package which was a perfect solution for installing in my 32 foot Fifth Wheel travel trailer. The frequent runs to fill propane bottles are finally over. My Wife and I are full-time RVers and have no problem keeping a temp of 80F in our drafty home during the Texas winters. I also installed a digital line voltage thermostat that keeps the temperature right where we want it. Works as advertised, easy installation, very quiet, and wattage options. FIVE STARS.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: But just doesn’t do what I need.
customer_reviews.text: The heater puts out some heat by with that heater and a combination of a wall heater I still could not get my room past 55°. The motor is quietBut just doesn’t do what I need.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Made in the USA (and made well!)
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect. They're quiet, and they're quality made. MADE IN THE USA! I've used these for years, and will NEVER buy the cheap cadet brand. Note: I wish they'd help out with "sizing", but the following is a good rule of thumb: 10 Watts per square foot. Got a 225 square foot room? Get a 2250 watt heater such as this. Got a 450 square foot room? Get two of them. john (Snohomish, Washington, USA)
customer_reviews.author: ItsNoGood!

customer_reviews.title: Great heater at a low price
customer_reviews.text: Works well, set it to 1000 watts and heats room efficiently. One star off because some of the spot welds were not held together when it arrived, this made the housing a little crooked and hard to install level.
customer_reviews.author: A. C.

customer_reviews.title: I love these things.
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these heaters now. Incredibly quiet (yes, you can hear it -- but barely, and it is a gentle noise anyway). Love that I can decide how much power I can allocate for the heater. Love that it works with a programmable thermostat like this one:with standard romex wiring. I installed my first one myself, and I am not a contractor or electrician. Turned an unusable room-near-attic-space into a warm inviting space. Have the second one in a bathroom and it works great on 750 watts.
customer_reviews.author: A. C. Payne

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: It’s a little noisy but not too bad. The fan is good and pushes the heat into the room nicely.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Bathroom Heater
customer_reviews.text: This in-wall heater is quiet and perfect for our bathroom. It is my FAVORITE bathroom feature! So nice on the cold mornings!
customer_reviews.author: MDG225

customer_reviews.title: super heater
customer_reviews.text: 560 sf of a no insulation building. Two King PAW heaters keep a cozy 75 degrees in cold weather. Can't find enough words to praise this small in wall heat machine. Put your money on one of these, you will be pleased ....(and warmed)
customer_reviews.author: Cecil C. Krone

customer_reviews.title: Dont need to run at max heat
customer_reviews.text: A little noisy but perfect replacement for old baseboard heaters
customer_reviews.author: PATRICK

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and good warranty
customer_reviews.text: I use these in my motel and have bought about 10 of them. Years later they are still operating and are adequate for a standard size hotel room
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Perfect product
customer_reviews.text: Had a room with no way to get ventilation to. Put this in and you'd never be able to tell it apart from my other vents. Good heat and makes zero noise. Make sure to get in line thermostat. Can't use standard multi wire thermostat
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: Good value.  Excellent heat.  Good customer service.
customer_reviews.text: Major upgrade to existing baseboards. I bought 4 Customer service is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Marlo

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful heat output and very quiet.
customer_reviews.text: Installed this in my camper as it was a perfect fit in some empty space just below the fridge. Perfectly cuts the chill off of cold nights camping.
customer_reviews.author: S. Corrow

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product.
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed to see how quiet and small this this unit was. The heat output is very impressive and moves air exceedingly well. I can't even hear it running. When installed in a wall with a standard vent cover this looks like just a standard HVAC register. I will definitely remember these guys next time I'm looking for space heaters. Made in the USA!
customer_reviews.author: Nick L.

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation, works great!
customer_reviews.text: Was easy to install. This replaced a 18 year old unit. Fit in the old box, and worked great. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Scott G. Houston

customer_reviews.title: Better than baseboards
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and circulates heat way better then base board and saved on elec. bill
customer_reviews.author: josh downing

customer_reviews.title: Most of the spot welds for the sheet metal box were bad
customer_reviews.text: I haven't even gotten to installation yet. Right out of the box most of the spot welds never took so its rattling and the structural integrity of the box is severely compromised. It's secured to studs via the box, no way I'm putting this in my wall.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Beloin

customer_reviews.title: Made in USA!  Quiet, and you can choose your heat outpiut
customer_reviews.text: Installs pretty easy, I retrofitted it and it all went well. Used 500 watts and it is a nice gentle very warm heat. Fan is very quiet! Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Crabber

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Ordered as a replacement. Easy to swap out. Working well so far. Arrived fast.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Sumner

customer_reviews.title: Great heat for small areas
customer_reviews.text: heater is expensive to buy / good thermostat is also
customer_reviews.author: LouR

customer_reviews.title: easy replacement install
customer_reviews.text: As a replacement this goes in easy. Use the existing can and wiring. Goes in quick . Just throw the new can away.
customer_reviews.author: kentuckydust

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: Works really well with small rooms. It does pull 1500 watts so a dedicated circuit is Necessary
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne Zaper

customer_reviews.title: Great Value - Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: Great alternative to provide heat to spaces where central air is not an option.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Loeffelman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Replaced two built in heaters on my boat with these, I had to set both at 1000 watt which was easy I have two more to replace will be ordering more soon
customer_reviews.author: jeff

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and fairly quite
customer_reviews.text: I've installed these in another house with no issues. Same results this time. Easy to install and fairly quite.
customer_reviews.author: scott

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Installed the guts in my old boxes and they work great.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great solution for heating individual rooms or supplementing heat to rooms that need just a little more!
customer_reviews.text: Highly effective! Heat the room in a matter of minutes. I also purchased a programmable thermostat, which makes these even more efficient and easy to use. I bought two and had them installed by an electrician.
customer_reviews.author: dbea

customer_reviews.title: Much better than baseboard
customer_reviews.text: Replaced baseboard heaters in foyer and bathroom. Works great, plan to replace more heater around my house.
customer_reviews.author: R. Schuman

customer_reviews.title: Very happy to find the exact heater replacement in one of ...
customer_reviews.text: Very happy to find the exact heater replacement in one of my rental units. Very good price and installation was super simple.
customer_reviews.author: B M

customer_reviews.title: It's great!
customer_reviews.text: This product has been great so far! I purchased it along with the King ESP230-R Electronic Line-Voltage Programmable Thermostat for my 400sq ft finished detached garage. It came wired for 240v, and it was a breeze to install. Simply follow the directions included, and you should not run into any issues. It takes a bit to heat up my garage due to the size, but once it gets heated, it's nice and toasty. Would definitely recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: grew

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: Love the ability to set the Watts! Made in USA; Origin USA
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: I've used this product over the years in apartment rentals and recommend them. Easy to install. The product has a long life.
customer_reviews.author: Noel M. Parker

customer_reviews.title: Great buy on the King wall heater.
customer_reviews.text: The heater was exactly perfect to replace my old heater, works like a charm. Will be ordering another one soon. Much better price than the big box stores.
customer_reviews.author: Lorelei Evert

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Quite operation. Had to modify to meet my needs to fit existing cut out and box.
customer_reviews.author: James M.

customer_reviews.title: King heater
customer_reviews.text: Better than expected and communication is excellent with this seller. I am very much pleased. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Nice Unit
customer_reviews.text: Much quieter than the dying unit it replaced. Nice to be able to adjust the heat output.
customer_reviews.author: Athelbert Z. Athelstan

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Put this in a master closet we added above our garage. Keeps the room warm and toasty. Runs quiet. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I initially gave it a 3 star because it frequently ...
customer_reviews.text: I initially gave it a 3 star because it frequently stopped working. The problem was not with the heater but with the location of my thermostat. My thermostat is located directly above the heater and it was picking up the heat directly from the heater, not from the ambient room temperature. I taped the vents in the thermostat and everything is now working fine
customer_reviews.author: walt

customer_reviews.title: replacement works great
customer_reviews.text: replacement heater for same. easy to exchange the guts of heater while leaving the old housing in place. heats well. maybe noisier than some others. but so easy to change out the old broken guts for the new working guts.
customer_reviews.author: bluetreedog

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a unit that was in the wall for about 15 years. Was easy to install by myself, since all the existing wiring was already in place. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: T.J.

customer_reviews.title: Electrical connectors on wrong side
customer_reviews.text: I had to return all 3 purchased heaters. The heaters have an electrical connection on the left side while my canisters had right side connections. It would have required rewiring by an electrician to install. Amazon did not include a photo of the heater unit itself only the grill.
customer_reviews.author: Gold Bar Bob

customer_reviews.title: King Heater
customer_reviews.text: This is an exact replacement for old heater and works just fine. Glad could get same one so it fit.
customer_reviews.author: sam

customer_reviews.title: Great Heater
customer_reviews.text: Nice heater I had one installed in my garage in 1999, It still works good so when I needed a couple more this is the heater I chose.
customer_reviews.author: Don Warren

customer_reviews.title: I know when I purchased this heater I knew it ...
customer_reviews.text: I know when I purchased this heater I knew it was in used condition, but the blower motor section was popped off and the blower wheel was bent. I had to repair and reassemble it before I could install it.
customer_reviews.author: BCS

customer_reviews.title: Great heater
customer_reviews.text: works great and the price was right! Keeps me toasty! Heats up fast and warms the entire room pretty quickly
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Poorly assembled by manufacturer
customer_reviews.text: Today is October 28, 2014 and I just received the heater. When I opened the box, I was disappointed to see that the guts of the heater are held in the box by one screw and they are loose. They will surely rattle around when this unit is on. For $144 I expect better quality, after all, there's really not much to these units. They're a squirrel fan and heating element...not much so to expect some quality control shouldn't be asking for much either.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: replacement heater
customer_reviews.text: easy to install and replace. Would have expected the first one to last more than 4 years but works well till it died.
customer_reviews.author: mbcleave

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly and installed exactly as the 20 year old heater that was replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Kent Bradstreet

customer_reviews.title: This is a great heater. I put a thermometer in front about ...
customer_reviews.text: Heater box is tough....when installing thermostat the holes would not permit thermostat screws to catch....had to drill larger. This is a great heater. I put a thermometer in front about 10 inches away to estimate heat output and it pegged at 120 degrees in 5 minutes at 10 inches in front. I recommend a thermostat as we did = King Electric TKIT-1BW Single pole (110).
customer_reviews.author: Gordon L. Writt

customer_reviews.title: I have this heater in every room of my house, very efficient
customer_reviews.text: This heater is very efficient and doesn't use as much energy as electric baseboard heaters. A little more money but worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: Ok for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Works fairly well. But guy they're over temp safety switch very very often. After which you may manually turn to a full off (0 power to the heater at all) for ten minutes until it will operate again. Even if it is a week later, you have to do this.
customer_reviews.author: it's me

customer_reviews.title: works as it should
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a replacement for a defective heater in a vacation home-it fits, it works and that's all that is needed
customer_reviews.author: Gary0529

product_meta.title: KING PAW2422-W PAW Electric Wall Heater, 2250W / 240V, White
product_meta.description:
Size:2250W / 240V| Color:WhiteThe Original Multi-Watt steel fin heater and our most popular heater for single family residences and upscale condominiums. King’s exclusive Pic-A-Watt steel fin element allows customers to select from a range of wattage options, tailoring the heater to an area’s specific heating requirements. Perfect for large living areas yet whisper quiet enough for bedrooms. The premium combination of an efficient high-mass steel element and whisper quiet squirrel cage blower, offers top of the class performance and years of trouble-free operation. PAW comes with five year and 30+ year history of reliability.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The original multi-watt steel fin heater. King's Pic-A-Watt series "Best" Fan Forced Wall Heater complete with wall can, interior and grill. An excellent upgrade heater. Unique design allows the user to change wattage output by disconnecting color-coded terminals. Contains a steel finned element for long life, a squirrel cage blower for quiet operation, and is equipped with the Patented Smart Limit Protection overheat safety system. The grill with rounded die-formed corners has a crisp clean appearance that blends in with any decor. This heater is frequently used as the primary heating system in apartments and homes, and as supplemental heat in residential and commercial applications. The PAW has a 12 year history of reliability, is made in the USA, and carries a 5-year warranty. It can be used with a built-in (TKIT) or wall-mount thermostat.
